comments:
Build 20021105

1. Started Eclipse.  My workspace had two editors opened.
2. Attempted to close one of the editors.  Didn't work due to graphic is 
disposed error.  Had to shut down Eclipse.  Once I restarted things were okay.  
It looks like I had the graphic is disposed call before I attempted to close 
the editor.  See log.

Just happened again to me when I was closing editors.  Here is the log.

*** Bug 25970 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Can't reproduce it. Need to reproduce to figure out where the image was 
disposed.
*** Bug 26748 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
See PR26748 for the same exception but in a difference situation.
*** Bug 27017 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 27081 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 25247 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Since I can't reproduce it, I can't be 100% sure that it is fixed. I analised 
the code and added a few checks to make sure the image was not disposed before 
the tab folder.

Closing as FIXED, please reopen if you see this problem again.
